00040 #ifndef _uilistbox_h
00041 #define _uilistbox_h
00042 
00043 #include "colourvalue.h"
00044 #include "enumerations.h"
00045 #include "uiwidget.h"
00046 
00047 namespace phys
00048 {
00049     namespace UI
00050     {
00051         class Rectangle;
00052         class Button;
00053         class Caption;
00054         class Scrollbar;
00055         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00056         /// @class ListBox
00057         /// @headerfile uilistbox.h
00058         /// @brief This is a widget for displaying a list of captions in a box.
00059         /// @details
00060         ///////////////////////////////////////
00061         class PHYS_LIB ListBox : public Widget
00062         {
00063             protected:
00064                 Rectangle* BoxBack;
00065                 /// @todo Third instance of needing to include the namespace in the declaration seemingly needlessly.
00066                 UI::Scrollbar* VertScroll;
00067                 Caption* Selected;
00068                 Caption* HoveredCaption;
00069                 std::vector<Caption*> Selections;
00070                 std::vector<Caption*> VisibleSelections;
00071                 bool AutoHideScroll;
00072                 Real LastScrollValue;
00073                 Real SelectionDist;
00074                 Whole NumVisible;
00075                 UI::TextHorizontalAlign THAlign;
00076                 UI::TextVerticalAlign TVAlign;
00077                 Whole TGlyph;
00078                 Vector2 TSize;
00079                 ColourValue TTColour;
00080                 ColourValue TBGColour;
00081                 ColourValue SelectColour;
00082                 /// @brief Determines how many items can be displayed in the box at once.
00083                 virtual void CalculateVisibleSelections();
00084                 /// @brief Updates the list of Visible buttons and hides the rest.
00085                 virtual void DrawList();
00086                 /// @brief For use with widget update/automation.
00087                 virtual void Update(bool Force = false);
00088             public:
00089                 /// @brief Standard initialization constructor.
00090                 /// @param name The name of the List Box.
00091                 /// @param Position The position of the List Box.
00092                 /// @param Size The size of the List Box.
00093                 /// @param ScrollbarWidth The relative(to screensize) width of the vertical scrollbar.
00094                 /// If a horizontal scrollbar is needed it'll use the equal value in pixels(to avoid the stretched look.
00095                 /// @param ScrollbarStyle The style of the scrollbar you want for this List Box.  See Scrollbar
00096                 /// class for more information.
00097                 /// @param Layer The parent layer this List Box belongs to.
00098                 ListBox(ConstString& name, const Vector2 Position, const Vector2 Size, const Real ScrollbarWidth, UI::ScrollbarStyle ScrollStyle, UILayer* Layer);
00099                 /// @brief Standard destructor.
00100                 ~ListBox();
00101                 /// @brief Sets the visibility of this List Box.
00102                 /// @param visible Bool determining whether or not this List Box should be visible.
00103                 virtual void SetVisible(bool visible);
00104                 /// @brief Gets the visibility of this List Box.
00105                 /// @return Returns a bool representing the visibility of this List Box.
00106                 virtual bool IsVisible();
00107                 /// @brief Forces this List Box to be shown.
00108                 virtual void Show();
00109                 /// @brief Forces this List Box to hide.
00110                 virtual void Hide();
00111                 /// @brief Checks to see if the current mouse position is over this List Box.
00112                 /// @return Returns a bool value, true if the mouse is over this List Box, false if it's not.
00113                 virtual bool CheckMouseHover();
00114                 /// @brief Sets the desired size and glyph set provided to all captions created within this widget.
00115                 /// @details This function needs to be called before adding any selections to this widget.
00116                 /// @param Size The size for all captions in this widget.
00117                 /// @param Glyph The Glyph set to be used for all captions created.  Glyphs are defined in your .gorilla file.
00118                 virtual void SetBasicTemplateParameters(Vector2 Size, const Whole Glyph);
00119                 /// @brief Sets additional optional perameters to the creation of each caption.
00120                 /// @details This function does not need to be called before creating captions, but if you plan to use this, it
00121                 /// would be a good idea to call this function prior to any creation.
00122                 /// @param BackgroundColour The colour to set for the captions background.
00123                 /// @param HorAlign The horizontal text alignment.  This defaults to UI::Middle.
00124                 /// @param VertAlign The Vertical text alignment.  This defaults to UI::Center.
00125                 virtual void SetMoreTemplateParameters(const ColourValue& TextColour = ColourValue(0.0,0.0,0.0,1.0),
00126                                                        const ColourValue& BackgroundColour = ColourValue(1.0,1.0,1.0,1.0),
00127                                                        UI::TextHorizontalAlign HorAlign = UI::Txt_Middle,
00128                                                        UI::TextVerticalAlign VertAlign = UI::Txt_Center);
00129                 /// @brief Adds a selectable caption to the list to be displayed.
00130                 /// @details If a colour other then white was set as the template and you try to set a background sprite, it will
00131                 /// attempt to blend the colour and sprite.  Pure white colour will cause the sprite to look normal.
00132                 /// @param TextLabel The text to be displayed within the created caption.
00133                 /// @param BackgroundSprite Optional, name of the sprite to set as it's background.  Ignored if the string is empty.
00134                 virtual Caption* AddSelection(ConstString& name, ConstString &Text, ConstString& BackgroundSprite = "");
00135                 /// @brief Gets a caption by name.
00136                 /// @param Name The name of the selectable caption you want to get.
00137                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the named caption.
00138                 virtual Caption* GetSelection(ConstString &Name);
00139                 /// @brief Destroys a selectable caption.
00140                 /// @param ToBeDestroyed A pointer to the caption you want destroyed and removed from this list.
00141                 virtual void DestroySelection(Caption* ToBeDestroyed);
00142                 /// @brief Destroys a selectable caption.
00143                 /// @param ToBeDestroyed A string naming the caption you want destroyed and removed from this list.
00144                 virtual void DestroySelection(String& ToBeDestroyed);
00145                 /// @brief Sets the distance apart(and from the sides of box) the Selections will be from each other.
00146                 /// @details This function expects a relative value to the screen size(0.0 to 1.0).  This value defaults to 0.
00147                 /// @param Dist A relative value for the distance to be used when determining the positions of Selections.
00148                 virtual void SetSelectionDistance(const Real Dist);
00149                 /// @brief Eanbles or disables the scrollbar autohide.
00150                 /// @param AutoHide A bool indicating whether or not to auto hide the scrollbar.
00151                 virtual void SetAutoHideScroll(bool AutoHide);
00152                 /// @brief Enables the setting of a background colour or sprite on the caption you select.
00153                 /// @details The background colour of captions default to white.
00154                 /// @param Colour The colour of the border.
00155                 virtual void EnableBackgroundSelector(const ColourValue &Colour);
00156                 /// @brief Disables borders on currently selected buttons if one was enabled.
00157                 virtual void DisableBackgroundSelector();
00158                 /// @brief Sets the relative position of this List Box.
00159                 /// @details The position is relative to the screen size.  Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
00160                 /// @param Position A vector2 representing the relative position of this List Box.
00161                 virtual void SetPosition(const Vector2 Position);
00162                 /// @brief Gets the relative position of this List Box.
00163                 /// @details The position is relative to the screen size.  Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
00164                 /// @return Returns a vector2 representing the relative position of this List Box.
00165                 virtual Vector2 GetPosition();
00166                 /// @brief Sets the pixel position of this List Box.
00167                 /// @param Position A vector2 representing the pixel position of this List Box.
00168                 virtual void SetActualPosition(const Vector2 Position);
00169                 /// @brief Sets the pixel position of this List Box.
00170                 /// @return Returns a vector2 representing the pixel position of this List Box.
00171                 virtual Vector2 GetActualPosition();
00172                 /// @brief Sets the relative size of this List Box.
00173                 /// @details The size is relative to the screen size.  Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
00174                 /// @param Size A vector2 representing the relative size of this List Box.
00175                 virtual void SetSize(const Vector2 Size);
00176                 /// @brief Gets the relative size of this List Box.
00177                 /// @details The size is relative to the screen size.  Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
00178                 /// @return Returns a vector2 representing the relative size of this List Box.
00179                 virtual Vector2 GetSize();
00180                 /// @brief Sets the pixel size of this List Box.
00181                 /// @param Size A vector2 representing the pixel size of this List Box.
00182                 virtual void SetActualSize(const Vector2 Size);
00183                 /// @brief Sets the pixel size of this List Box.
00184                 /// @return Returns a vector2 representing the pixel size of this List Box.
00185                 virtual Vector2 GetActualSize();
00186                 /// @brief Gets the currently selected caption.
00187                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the currently selected caption, or NULL if none are selected.
00188                 virtual Caption* GetSelected();
00189                 /// @brief Gets the background of this List Box.
00190                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the background of this List Box.
00191                 virtual Rectangle* GetBoxBack();
00192                 /// @brief Gets the scrollbar used within this List Box.
00193                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the scrollbar of this List Box.
00194                 virtual UI::Scrollbar* GetVertScroll();
00195         };
00196     }//UI
00197 }//phys
00198 
00199 #endif
